name: Lakasa
address: Plaza del Descubridor Diego de Ordás, 1, 28003 Madrid, Spain
review:
Traveling in Madrid alone, I wanted to treat myself to a good authentic Spanish meal and this place seemed to fit the bill. After doing some research, I.... Yes, it is that good. 

Yes, you should definitely make reservations. 

Yes, you should get the mussels. 

Yes, please save room for desserts. 

Cannot wait.... It is my fifth time to be here. It is hard to believe I live on the other side of the world! This is definitely the restaurant you never want to miss! The....

name: Sala de Despiece
review:
An amazing meal!

It's an omakase style dinner, pre fixe, with the ability to add on sides, but with the amount of food, there is no need for adding.... Amazing, unlike anything. Smart concept, I've ever experienced before. 
Make reservations and come open minded to try things, you typically don't like. 
And.... Ok so this review is technically for the SDD2 location, but they are not on Yelp so I will add it here!

Made a reservation a few weeks prior and came for....

name: Burnout
review:
Over the last eight months living in Madrid, I have tried a slew of burger places, but Burnout is by far the best. Though the burgers are very messy to eat,.... I am sorry to say that the hype connected to this restaurant is way over the top.  My friend brought me here because he said he had an excellent visit last.... We had the prifix menu. €11 included a drink. A burger and a desert. 
The desert was not good. We had the chocolate cake and the carrot cake. Carrot cake....

name: Bacira
review:
An affordable Michelin-starred restaurant in Madrid! 

Bacira, like many Spanish restaurants, has a menú del día for weekday lunches, and this one is easily.... Alert alert, this is a legitimate destination restaurant if you're in Madrid. I honestly can't remember the last meal I had at this price point -- $115 US.... MUST HAVE THE FRESH TUNA AND ALSO THE RISOTTO!!!

Everything we ate here was top notch. The flavors were all unlike anything I've ever ate. The atmosphere....

name: InClan Brutal
review: Amazing cocktails and good service!!!!! Also love their decor and fantastic cocktail menu.. This is a place you go for the atmosphere and for fun pictures. It is exactly what you expect. Every part of the restaurant is thought out. From the selfie.... How fun is this place?!? I am so glad I found this place on yelp. We were not hungry when we came in but needed a place to sit before heading to the....

name: Rosi La Loca
review: Rosie La Loca is the result of someone saying "how can make tapas fun, funky, and slightly fairytalish".  They achieved their vision .   There is no moment,.... Super underrated here in Madrid. The first and last place for original Tapas. We accidentally stumbled in on this place and were blown away. Then traveled.... We went here our first night in Madrid after searching quickly for someplace to eat, and it was packed. If you want to eat inside, you have to make a....

name: La Gabinoteca
address: Calle de Fernández de la Hoz, 53, 28003 Madrid, Spain
review:
The food was amazing and the service was top notch. We ordered a total of 5 different dishes, a pitcher of sangria and a desert. 

The tapa dishes were all.... Looking for a late night "snack", (just before midnight) we walked around the corner from our hotel and discovered La Gabinoteca, a quaint Tapas restaurant.... Nice place, with a different design. We went for dinner, and had: caesar salad (which comes in a different way, very nice by the way); vieiras tapas and....

name: Tuk Tuk
address: Calle del Cardenal Cisneros, 6, 28010 Madrid, Spain
review: After 3 days of tapas we needed some Asian food. Tuk tuk was nearby so we decided to give it a try. When we arrived at 8pm the restaurant was a bit empty.... We walked into this place close to their closing time but the hostess did not give us a hard time and welcomed us. Being vegetarian we are skeptical of.... If you find yourself in Madrid with a craving for Thai, this place might do the trick but it's not worth a trip otherwise. Or maybe it was just me and what....

name: La H es Muda
review: We never have much luck with burgers in Europe, so our expectations were set pretty low. Let me say that even if we had gone in with high expectations, they.... First time in Madrid and I guess was being nostalgic of my U.S. foods so walking down the street came across this burger place. A little hard to miss unless.... I love, love, loved this place. In house brew was tasty. The service was awesome. The decor was clean and contemporary. It was really fun and light in....

name: La Musa
address: Calle de Manuela Malasaña, 18, 28004 Madrid, Spain
review: Had a great lunch amongst the 4 of us, w fresh salads, fried Green tomatoes, langosti ba, venison, and duck gyozas. our waiter Luis was great! highly.... My partner and I stopped by La Musa for some lunch while visiting Madrid. The food was absolutely amazing, the staff were great, the atmosphere was lively.... Fun night out in Madrid. Small restaurant with very friendly helpful waitstaff. Ordered the tasting menu which is a good mix of the tapas. Would recommend....

name: La Mi Venta
address: Plaza de la Marina Española, 7, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review:
Delicious seafood paella and refreshing sangriaI usually don't like sangria, way too sweet in my palate but we trusted our waiter and tried it. Oh my gosh,.... Reseñas en español y ingles:

La Mi Venta is across the street from the National Palace (Palacio Real de Madrid), so it's near a very popular area of the.... Excellent restaurant close to the palace and Plaza de Espana. Come as a partty so you can order some of the larger peices of meat and paella, which serve....

name: Ten con Ten
review: This place came highly recommended by a friend who had just visited Madrid on his honeymoon--and it did not ​. The atmosphere was an intimate setting, yet.... Because, Madrid, in reality, is nothing special. It does not have a great river, and hardly any skyscrapers. No channels, no lakes. Neither glorious ruins,.... We visited this restaurant because it was highly recommended by a friend and it didn't disappoint. We had a great meal and service was outstanding.  We....

name: La Gastro
review:
Highly recommend for tapas and drinks!!

We found La Gastro on yelp since we were at a cafe close by and wanted to stop for dinner. They open at 9pm and.... Fusion of Spanish, Asian, Middle Eastern and Latin American influences - this is a gastronomical experience that blew our minds away. We tried the croqueta.... As Americans in Madrid who are not interested in tourist fare we wanted to get away from Gran Via. We read good reviews about La Gastro and gave it a shot.....

name: Celso y Manolo
address: Calle de la Libertad, 1, 28004 Madrid, Spain
review: Oh my goodness this place was adorable. We ate here our first night in Madrid. The service was fabulous and the food was amazing!!! We are still talking.... Ate here Aug 2022 and thought it was good but definitely more on the pricey side than other restaurants we went in Madrid. Since it's such highly rated on.... With such great yelp reviews we wanted to check out this restaurant on our last night in Madrid! We were lucky to get a reservation. This restaurant is very....

name: Ristorante Il Pastaio
address: Calle de Ríos Rosas, 49, 28003 Madrid, Spain
review:
SO impressed by the staff!

We interacted with everyone who worked there and they were all so sweet and professional. The food was incredible and because we.... Stumbled upon this restaurant on the streets of Madrid and was pleasantly surprised. We opted to split a bottle of rose which came in an ice bag so that it.... After two weeks of Spanish food and tapas we ready for something else. We discovered this hidden little gem. Great Italian food! We ate here twice during....

name: The Little Big Café
description: Breakfast & Brunch Coffee & Tea Juice Bars & Smoothies
address: Calle de Fernández de los Ríos, 61, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: Lovely café with free wifi (just ask for password). Small capacity but not always full. Great array of items on menu. Good coffee. This is the first iced.... The Little Big Café is my favorite brunch and coffee place in Madrid so far. The staff is so friendly and there are a wide variety of options to pick from.... We went to Little Big Café on a Saturday around noon, and were lucky enough to snag a table outside. We ended up deciding on the brunch special, which cost....

name: Goiko Grill
address: Calle de María de Molina, 20, 28006 Madrid, Spain
review:
There is no other word than AMAZING !!!! Best burgers i ever had and believe me, i ate a lot of burgers in my life !
I tried almost the whole menu by now.... After three weeks in Europe (and lots of our own cooking,) we were jonesing for a premium burger. Lots of local and chain options where we're staying in the.... Well finally took the time to try out the famous hamburgues in Goiko grill. This franchise is all over Spain, and now I was gonna taste a burguer from them....

name: Food Truck
review:
Un gran descubrimiento.
Los cheese ticks estaban riquísimos y la burger de costillas una pasada.
Un sitio altamente recomendable..

name: Lúa
address: Paseo de Eduardo Dato, 5, 28003 Madrid, Spain
review: Lúa means "moon" in Galacian (the language spoken by those from Galacia, a region on the northwest corner of Spain). Lúa is one of only a handful of.... The tasting menu was a bit excessive for lunch -- it felt like quite the marathon. The first course knocked it out of the park with interesting flavours.... Lovely intimate restaurant where classic cooking technique shines. Their pork belly, beef cheeks and ceviche were delicious and perfectly prepared. They....

name: 80 Grados
address: Calle de Manuela Malasaña, 10, 28004 Madrid, Spain
review: This was so good! The epitome of a Malasaña tapas restaurant. Dessert and food was to die for, definitely recommend!. 80 degrees, that's the temperature that they cook EVERYTHING at.  It was one of our best meals in Madrid.  They have a lunchtime formula for less than 15€.... 80 Grados was probably my favorite meal from my time in Madrid -- and considering how much fantastic food I had, that's really saying something. My friend....

name: The Toast
address: Calle de Fernando el Católico, 50, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
I love it! I visited twice on my five days vacation in Madrid and even though we had to walk quiet a bit - it was worth it.

Especially second time was.... When you first walk into this restaurant, you see a very cute, cozy space with a small bar and some unique/indie decorations throughout. My girlfriend and I.... Best breakfast we had in Madrid.  Friendly, Fast, & clean, so happy to have discovered this restaurant on our last day. We had the breakfast burrito &....

name: Perrachica
review:
Great place , good vibe, the food is good, a bit pricey though for what it is 
Portions are small ( at least for the octopus which was fantastic but way too.... This goes worse and worse. I was recently forced to come here by some friends, and literally this is not a place for people who know about restaurants. More.... Trendy, loud and lively. Great place for a fun night out. The milanesa itself was nothing special althought the truffle and egg added all the flavor needed.....

name: Hanan
review:
We ordered the vegetarian plate for two persons (37€), and we each had a couple of beers to go with it (which increased our bill to a total of 47€).    The.... On our last night in Madrid, we wanted to try something different as we were tired of Spanish tapas and italian food.
We love Ethiopian food and came here.... Seeing as Yelp has a large American audience, I feel like it's fair that I review this restaurant through the lens of an American.  I'm fully aware of the....

name: Gingerboy
review:
Recently got take-out from Ginger Boy and was very impressed!  I will definitely return!

There's no seating inside, so this place is strictly take-away.... Really good take out spot. And you can order online! I had the gingerboy vegetable curry and jasmine rice. It was quite good, but it's pricy for what you get.. Love this little spot in Madrid. Really impressed with the quality of the food and the spices used. My favorite is the chicken pad thai but my boyfriend....

name: El Paraguas
address: Calle de Jorge Juan, 16, 28001 Madrid, Spain
review: The restaurant offers an elegant and formal ambience with a great atmosphere and professional and customer service driven professionals in the food.... I would highly discourage anyone from eating at El Paraguas while visiting Madrid, despite the oddly high ratings. Clearly the customers who have reviewed.... Tiene trenta minutos Para conseguir agua...servicio muy mal,  comida nada especial y cara. Buenos noches!! Nunca volver..

name: Goiko Grill
review: AMAZING. Anyone that travels to Spain needs to spot by Goiko and try the best burgers ever!!. Being an American expat in Europe, I crave a good burger every now and then. Goiko is the best spot to go to if you're looking for great signature burgers!.... The burgers are really good but a medium is basically a rare so if you don't like a pink center, then I would say medium well or even well done. I ordered a....

name: La Tape
review: My wife and I stopped here for an early lunch and chose it specifically because they have craft beer, which isn't quite as common as any city in the US.  As.... Atmosphere is pretty good. The food looks good. The wait staff is decent. Pleasant. I like the place. Across the street from the apartment where I'm staying.... All I have to say is you gotta get the burger. Just satisfying and nice and juicy. Toasted bun is a plus. Also great beer!.

name: Cardamomo Tablao Flamenco
review:
Wonderful show in a great ambiance.

I was able to easily book my ticket online just a few hours prior to the show. I booked category A (closest to the.... Great experience.  I'd recommend them.

For a quick, one hour taste of Flamenco, this is a good Madrid choice.  They get you in and out efficiently. 

I got.... I'll be honest: I didn't know what Flamenco was before I saw this show. I knew it was a Spanish tradition. I figured that "flamenco" probably derives from....

name: Pizzaiolo
review:
This might be our family's favorite restaurant in Madrid. Yes, the pizza, food, and dessert are wonderful; however, what makes it just a touch above, is the.... This is by far the best pizza I have had, amazing!! My girlfriend also had pasta and it was just really good. Would 100% recommend.. Best pizza I've ever had! 

This place was such a gem; wanted to go to pizzateca due to the reviews on Yelp originally but it was closed so we came here and....

name: Botín
review:
Historical restaurant that we felt honored to have dined here, in aug 2022.

The service was great. The friendly cute waiter even took a photo with.... MADRID - 05/07/23 - What makes Botin so special other than it's listed as the oldest restaurant in the world by the Guinness Book of World Records.  Botin.... We were here 4/20/23 with a reservation and were seated immediately. It was a little hot that day, so my fiancé wore a sleeveless tank. Ooops! Thankfully,....

name: Kitchen 154
address: Mercado Vallehermoso, Calle Vallehermoso, 36, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: I've been to a lot asian inspired, fusion style restaurants in Madrid. But this one is just AMAZING!! situated in a market, adding the feel of a humble.... Kitchen 154 is a food stall that appears in various markets around Madrid. It appears regularly in the Mercado de Productores at the Matadero, in.... Ww went to a kitchen 154 for lunch on the recommendation by our tour guide. It's a corner shop in the market. Local Asian fusion place not a lot of....

name: El Ferry
review:
This was a great brunch place. It has a very cute atmosphere and the staff were very nice. The french toast was wonderful.. El Ferry is located in a great location, just outside of the Bilbao Metro. The decor is a modern take on an american style diner and is very welcoming.

We.... El Ferry a true 50s diner that mixes it up nicely and is willing to try new things. The Weekend brunch is among the best in town as other reviewers have....

name: Angelita
address: Calle de la Reina, 4, 28004 Madrid, Spain
review:
Really nice cozy place in the heart of Madrid !!

Great server!. We are huge winos, so my wife surprised me with this experience. In America this bill would of easily been $120-150 here with tip we spent $60. Im legit.... Having been living in Madrid for about a month now I can easily say that Angelita has been in my top two if not, my favorite dining experience. We made....

name: La Cabaña Argentina
address: Calle de Ventura de la Vega, 10, 28014 Madrid, Spain
review: What a great surprise to find this restaurant it will be worth the trip down this small road.  Artichokes we're out of this world and the ribeye steak and.... Place was insanely good. Only problem is I was to full or order seconds. Highly recommend for amazing food . Everything tasted beyond good. Ambiance was.... Spectacular food. My wife had the octopus and I had the steak with pepper sauce. We followed that up with a bottle of wine and an amazing flambé crepe with....

name: La Pescadería
address: Calle de la Ballesta, 32, 28004 Madrid, Spain
review: First evening in madrid after a long day of travel and our host at the ALoft Grand Via recommends La Pescaderia.  What a perfect way to start a vacation..... We are spoiled with NYC food scene so judging restaurants in a different country is always hard. That being said, food at this place was awesome. Every.... Es perfecto! Wonderful food, great atmosphere and amazing service Karolyn was very welcoming..

name: Rochela
address: Calle del Cardenal Cisneros, 58, 28010 Madrid, Spain
review: My (Colombian) wife was craving Colombian food and we were told of another place but we couldn't find it. So we looked up other restaurants and found this.... Excellent food, service and attention! Better than any other Colombian restaurant we've ever been to.. I recently visited Rochela for the first time with a Colombian friend who likes it. I'm not new to Colombian food, but I did try some new dishes and drinks,....

name: Cafetería HD
address: Calle de Guzmán el Bueno, 67, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Classy old school joint lush with retro details--all it needs is Dean Martin. The sunny side egg on my burger was cooked so perfectly that with the juicy.... So this is exactly how you adjust yourself to the new era!! 
This place is a traditional bar which has been able to change according to costumes.... This place never grabbed my attention from the outside, but once I found out it came from Grupo La Musa, I decided to give it a try when I was in the mood....

name: Metro Bistro
review:
I highly recommend metro bistro because of their €39.5 7 course tasting menu. We started off with this incredible pumpkin soup with a strong cheese..... Siriloin steak too salty 
Too salty 
Potatoes gratin not good .
Very mediocre food 
Very disappointed. One of the best meals of my 8 day trip to Spain & Portugal! My friend met me in Madrid for the first night and we ended up at Metro Bistro after I found....

name: Tierra
address: Calle de Guzmán el Bueno, 52, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Tried my first ever burrito here and I keep coming back! One of my favorite places to eat. 

I usually get everything on my chicken burrito so I always.... This is the Spanish version of Chipotle in the USA.
Chaotic during lunch time and no seats at this location. The food was flavorless but I'm sure healthier.... So grateful for this little place. Delicious Mexican food, at a good price and chipotle-like ease with ordering. The ingredients are all delicious, and....

name: Kalúa Helado Artesanal
description: Juice Bars & Smoothies Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt Cafeteria
review:
Lalúa is by far my favorite place for ice cream in Madrid. They have so many flavors in almost overwhelming!

This place gets packed, especially when it.... My boyfriend and I have tried gelato in Argentina and all throughout Italy, and Kalúa is as close as you can get to that quality while in Madrid. Kalúa not.... Delicious gelato! Some of the best I've ever had!! I went back two days in a row because it was so good! Highly recommend the Oreo and mango!.

name: Oven
review:
A very pleasant surprise for my family looking to eat something different after so many days of eating Spanish food. This is a legit Italian restaurant!!.... Went to this joint on our way to the Manchester United vs. Atletico Madrid game. Amazing pizza and was recommended to me by an Italian pizza chef I stayed.... My first pizza place I've tried in Madrid! It's a little pricey  compared to normal pizza places in the states, but you are paying for the ambiance. 

What....

name: La Gringa
address: Calle San Vicente Ferrer, 57, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
YUM YUM YUM 

if you are living in Madrid or anywhere outside the United States and you miss your typical American Brunch or if you have never been to the.... Intentionally went to Carmencita Bar but because we didn't place a reservation and they were busy, they sent us to La Gringa a few steps down the street..... Wow, just wow, this place is amazing!! A few friends and I went here for brunch yesterday and everything was amazing! There was a little bit of a wait for....

name: Hanakura
review: Great authentic Japanese food in Madrid! I came here with a friend from Japan and we all loved the food. The menu del dia is incredibly generous and the....

name: Zenith
review:
This was one of the places I had saved on my restaurants to visit when I was in Madrid for NYE, and I was so glad I was able to pop in. It also helped that.... This location is clearly catered towards towards tourists and the food suffers because of it.

The waiters aren't assigned and just rotate through randomly.... Modern, spacious, and great ambiance 

My boyfriend and I came for brunch and got seated pretty quickly. We ordered the zenith pancakes and eggs Benedict....

name: Las Tortillas de Gabino
address: Calle de Rafael Calvo, 20, 28010 Madrid, Spain
review:
This was truly a fantastic experience! The service was outstanding the food flawless, and the venue was pleasant for casual, dating, family, whatever. 

We.... Very glad we did a little research around the area we were staying.  We ended up choosing this place because it seemed more of a local formal dinner, which.... I spotted this on Yelp when looking for somewhere to eat near the Museo Sorolla and got EXTREMELY excited at the prospect of a merging of tortilla and....

name: Carmencita
address: Calle San Vicente Ferrer 57, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: Una vez vine con algunos familiares y de verdad que quedamos asombrados con la buena atención y la comida, todo era muy especial y rico, volveremos a venir.... This place was amazing! The food was soo delicious and they had traditional, vegetarian, and vegan options! The freshly squeezed Oj was very tasty. They do.... Cute quant brunch spot. Food is A+++ and service was amazing!!! Price of food was also good.  They have mimosas by the pitcher for 8€ and brunch is all day.....

name: Macera
description: Cocktail Bars Modern European Tapas Bars
review:
I could not be more serious when I say- this is the best gin drink I've ever had. It was so smooth and delicious! And I used to casually like gin before,.... This place is awesome. Custom made cocktail, or choose from a list already with the ingredients, both are great! 

For the custom ones, you choose your.... Super fun and chill place for a fun twist on the gin tonic with various macerations and infusions! Ordering was a little confusing at first, but when you....

name: Pimiento Verde
review: The food was so good, I'm going back tomorrow. I had 2/2 order of the flowered artichokes, 2/2 order croquettes, roasted peppers with tuna. I'll go back for.... Very good food, great service. I've been here twice and no disappointment. Give this restaurant a try!. I don't know the hours of this establishment but it was open for lunch and dinner early enough for people who don't want to wait until 730 or 830 for a....

name: Casa Toni
address: Calle de la Cruz, 14, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review: This spot is as good as people say - tasty tapas, large portions, friendly (and English-speaking!) service, and located right in the center of Madrid. We.... Casa Toni was one of the best places my wife and I visited in Spain. We found out about it on the Spain Revealed channel un YouTube. A great channel you.... Best place in Madrid for authentic Spanish tapas.  The reviews are excellent and they are right on target.  Rick Steves also featured it in one of his....
